1.title: Scent Affairs
1.subtitle: Our goal is to continuously strive to make and provide a quality product. The goal, create a safe, effective, quality product with a long lasting scentual affect.

1.title: Stay Informed: Ma'Khia Bryant Shooting
1.subtitle: A teenage girl who the police say threatened two girls with a knife was fatally shot by an officer in Columbus, Ohio, on Tuesday, April 20th, 2021, shortly before a jury reached a guilty verdict in the murder trial of the former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin in last year’s killing of George Floyd.

2.title: Colorism in the Beauty Industry
2.subtitle: America has progressed tremendously over recent years in terms of racial inequality, but colorism remains to be seen on a global scale.

2.title: John Hope - Biography
2.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

3.title: Bedroom Kandi
3.subtitle: Welcome to Bedroom Kandi, where women, men, and their partners can pamper themselves with intimate luxury! At Bedroom Kandi, our mission is to destigmatize intimacy and self-love, promote sexual wellness and education, and empower entrepreneurs to find success and happiness in the business of pleasure.

3.title: What Happened on May 25th?
3.subtitle: On May 25th, 2020, George Floyd was in Minneapolis on business, far from his family and community, when four Minneapolis police officers murdered him in broad daylight. It was a modern day lynching as those police officers served as judge, jury, and executioner on an unarmed, non-violent, handcuffed Black man.

4.title: Find Your Representatives
4.subtitle: Here you can find your representatives, how to contact them, bills they’ve introduced, committees they serve on, and political contributions they’ve received.

4.title: Criminal Justice Facts
4.subtitle: The Sentencing Project compiles state-level criminal justice data from a variety of sources. Using this state-by-state data feature, you can navigate between interactive maps, tables, and rankings that allow you to access and use these data.

5.title: Tell Congress to Support the MORE Act (H.R. 3884/S. 2227)
5.subtitle: We believe in cannabis legalization, but only if it’s got justice baked right in. Even with more and more states saying yes to legal cannabis, hundreds of thousands of people are still being arrested every year, most of them for possession—and they are disproportionately Black. It doesn’t have to be that way. With your help we can legalize cannabis while expunging prior cannabis convictions, and make 4/20 a day we all can celebrate.

5.title: Shop Thoughtful
5.subtitle: thoughtful is a nonprofit that seeks to promote black businesses and create a one-stop-shop for consumers who want to vote with their wallets. thoughtful does not take any commissions off of the businesses it promotes, it is purely a hub designed to uplift and support established Black-owned businesses online.

products.name: Olivia Twist Headband
products.description: This is timeless versatility. Two loops of our cotton fabric linked at center. An alluring piece for easy, low maintenance styles.

products.name: Black Trans Lives
products.description: #BlackTransLivesMatter

products.name: Nano-Ionic Facial Steamer
products.description: Facial steam combined with ionic water particles is up to 10x more effective than other facial steamers in penetrating the skin.

6.title: Ashay by the Bay
6.subtitle: We are an Independent Minority Owned Business and Deborah Day is the Founder and CEO. She opened the business in 2000 and started selling books online in 2002, establishing Ashay by the Bay as a Book Reseller that Specializes in African American and Multi-Cultural Children’s Books, Baby-3 and K-12 for Schools and Organizations.  We sell a Diverse Selection of books to both the Consumer and Business Markets and we Build Custom Collections for School and Classroom Libraries.  We also sell Gift Cards provide and we are the publishers of the Mindful Messages Curriculum.  Our home office is located in Vallejo, California. and we sell books throughout the US, Canada and select Markets around the world.

6.title: Diarrablu
6.subtitle: The Diarrablu mission is to iterate for sustainability while highlighting the African continent’s rich colors and unique patterns through practical and versatile pieces designed using mathematical concepts or algorithms.

products.name: Sustainable Mailys Dress - Noir
products.description: Sustainable, artisanal and size inclusive, the Mailys Dress is easily convertible into over 19 different styles. This garment is a comfortable and versatile dress thoughtfully designed to fit all body shapes and sizes.

products.name: Headwrap - Suto
products.description: These statement pieces are part of our zero-waste sustainable approach as we believe in maximizing the usage of all our fabrics.

products.name: Hidden in Ocho Rios | Art Print
products.description: In this piece, we daydream of an impromptu retreat in Ocho Rios, Jamaica in a hidden tree-house covered in palm leaves.

7.title: Black on Black
7.subtitle: Black On Black™ is beautifully designed clothing & accessories that are both clothing line AND protest sign. Black On Black™ is a social protest on clothing that De:Constructs the Construct.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows
products.description: These cozy throw pillows feature high-quality fabric and prints that will upgrade your space. Zippered cover care instructions: machine wash in cold water using mild detergent and gentle cycle only, hang to dry.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T
products.description: Juneteenth is the oldest known celebration commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.  Dating back to 1865, it was on June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free.

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T
products.description: "Black Powered" T-Shirt - When I think about the greatness of us and all that we've been able to become DESPITE all that we've been through and STILL going through, one reason that is specific to us is, US.

7.title: Ruth Nathan's
7.subtitle: It is Nicole R. Brown's desire that Ruth Nathan’s does not only make customers look spectacular but feel spectacular as well, positively influencing them to feel better about themselves. It is a known fact that when one dresses well, one feels better—and from an outfit that is well put together, that makes one walk with pride, the Urban Peacock emerges.

products.name: Blue Curved Mask
products.description: Still want to look dapper while protecting yourself and others? We have the answer! Reusable and re-washable, these fabric masks will keep you looking good and doing good. When you buy a curved face mask from Ruth Nathan’s we donate a rectangular face mask to health care professionals and essential workers in need.

products.name: Franc Bleu Bow Tie
products.description: The deep older brother of the Franc Un pattern, the Franc Bleu’s watercolor pen lines convey elegance and a truly historic sense of style. Also inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Bleu carries notes of art deco, dancing under the stars, and midnight.

products.name: Franc Un Pocket Square
products.description: Inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Un pattern gives off a refined yet playful vibe sure to elevate your look during formal occasions. Perfect for when you want to be taken seriously—but not too seriously. Notes of Art Deco, French Quarter jazz, and pistachios.

8.title: How to Be an Antiracist
8.subtitle: Ibram X. Kendi's concept of antiracism reenergizes and reshapes the conversation about racial justice in America—but even more fundamentally, points us toward liberating new ways of thinking about ourselves and each other.

8.title: TGEU International Women’s Day - Inclusivity Media Statement
8.subtitle: On the occasion of the International Women’s Day (IWD) on 8 March, TGEU joins the voices of trans people around the world in denouncing oppression, violence, and hate against women and non-binary people in all spheres of life.

9.title: Natural Cuties
9.subtitle: Natural Cuties is a brand that promotes, encourages and highlights the beauty of African American hair in its natural state! #Iamanaturalcutie are you?

products.name: I am a Natural Cutie Book
products.description: Phoenix is excited about rocking her big afro puffs on the first day of Kindergarten. After hearing the other girls make fun of her puffs she is ready to go home. She will soon learn just what it means to be a NATURAL Cutie!

products.name: Drawstring Bag
products.description: Combine your love for vibrant prints and a sporty style with a cool drawstring bag. It’s a must-have gym essential that can be worn as a backpack with drawstring closure at top, and narrow, contrasting shoulder straps.

products.name: Mug
products.description: Whether you’re drinking your morning coffee, your evening tea, or something in between – this mug’s for you! It’s sturdy and glossy with a vivid print that’ll withstand the microwave and dishwasher.

9.title: How the Dodgers 'Took' Jackie Robinson | Field of Dreams...Deferred Part 3
9.subtitle: Brooklyn Dodgers executive Branch Rickey signed Jackie Robinson from the Kansas City Monarchs in 1945, but he refused to pay Negro League teams for their players. Watch more on the fight to integrate MLB in "Field of Dreams...Deferred" Part 3.

10.title: Derek Chauvin sentencing
10.subtitle: A Hennepin County jury found Derek Chauvin guilty on all three counts against him on Tuesday, April 20, 2021, setting the stage for the sentencing of the former Minneapolis officer. Here's what we know about when sentencing will happen and what to expect.

10.title: How studying privilege systems can strengthen compassion
10.subtitle: Her TED Talk offers a shift in the traditional view of race, equity and privilege. McIntosh uses her own experience as a white woman to inform her own knowledge of racial experiences from a white perspective.

11.title: How Negro History Week Became Black History Month and Why It Matters Now
11.subtitle: Black History Month has been celebrated in the United States for close to 100 years. But what is it, exactly, and how did it begin?

11.title: Can the Beauty Industry Confront Colorism?
11.subtitle: The beauty industry has been trying to productively confront racism. Can it do the same with colorism, where lighter-skinned models are favored over those with darker skin?

12.title: Figgers Communication Inc.
12.subtitle: Figgers Communication is where the entire buzz on the internet and social media comes to rest in your pocket! We are a telecommunications company that provides Cellular, Mobile Broadband, Home phone and international calling services.

12.title: Remembering South African leader Nelson Mandela
12.subtitle: Nelson Mandela, the first black president of South Africa credited with ending apartheid there, died in Johannesburg on Dec. 5, 2013. Former PBS NewsHour correspondent Charlayne Hunter-Gault takes a look back at Mandela's life and legacy.

13.title: First police report in Tyre Nichols case does not match video
13.subtitle: An initial police report filed in the hours after the Tyre Nichols traffic stop suggested he was violent and made claims that were contradicted by video later released by police.

13.title: Why Many Americans Can’t See The Wealth Gap Between White And Black America
13.subtitle: In the last year and a quarter, the pandemic has served as a stark reminder of just how unequal America still is. But it also hasn’t been a “reminder” for everyone. Black Americans and other Americans of color didn’t have the luxury of forgetting that American society is unequal.

14.title: Automotive Heroes of Black History Month
14.subtitle: Ever wonder what driving would be like without turn signals or traffic lights? Well, without these great inventors, engineers, scientists, and pioneers of their field, driving wouldn’t be what it is today! In celebration of Black History Month, we want to share a few of their exciting stories with you.

14.title: Book: Understanding Mass Incarceration
14.subtitle: A People's Guide to the Key Civil Rights Struggle of Our Time

15.title: AllGoudes & Services
15.subtitle: Whether you have a college degree and are seeking to make your first steps onto your career path, or just looking to secure steady income by obtaining an entry level position; AllGoudes and Services makes sure that you’ll be ALLGOUDE in your job search! It’s your time! Let us help you display your worth to potential employers.

15.title: Me and White Supremacy
15.subtitle: Based on the viral Instagram challenge that captivated participants worldwide, Me and White Supremacy takes readers on a 28-day journey, complete with journal prompts, to do the necessary and vital work that can ultimately lead to improving race relations.

16.title: Mike D's BBQ
16.subtitle: Mike D's BBQ is an award winning line of signature BBQ sauces and all-purpose dry rubs. Our sauces are a twist on the traditional BBQ sauce with some unique seasonings and spice levels.

products.name: BIG Sauce Set
products.description: Mike D's BIG Sauce is our twist on a traditional BBQ Sauce. It has the perfect blend of smoky and sweet just like our rub. There is a small hint of heat to balance the flavors, but it is a very mild sauce overall.

products.name: Rub Master Set
products.description: Are you a master with the dry rub? This set allows you to use both award winning rubs on large and small meals like the master you are! This set contains one of each large rub (10.24 ounces)!

products.name: Throw Some D's On It T-Shirt
products.description: Rep your favorite BBQ brand and let everyone know they need to "Throw Some D's On It"

16.title: Abolish Prison Labor in the USA
16.subtitle: Prison labor is a form of modern American slavery used by multiple large corporations across the world. Under the 13th Amendment to the United States Constitution, slavery was merely reformed rather than abolished. Racial justice in the USA cannot be achieved until prison labor is abolished completely.

17.title: Princess Planet
17.subtitle: Princess Planet is a brand of children's entertainment that helps promote characters with diverse hair textures, skin tones, and cultural backgrounds.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 1
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume One is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 2
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume Two is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun.

products.name: Princess Planet: Coloring book
products.description: The Princess Planet Coloring Book showcases sixteen unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

17.title: The Bail Project
17.subtitle: The Bail Project™ National Revolving Bail Fund is on a mission to combat mass incarceration and reshape the pretrial system in the United States. 100% of online donations are used to bring people home. Since bail money comes back to us when cases close, we're able to recycle every dollar donated at least twice per year.

18.title: Raycon
18.subtitle: Raycon is built around the mission that everyone deserves to enjoy great audio. We believe amazing audio experiences inspire go-getters around the world and power their everyday lives.

products.description: Our most compact wireless earbuds for your everyday grind. Designed to deliver more powerful sound than any earbuds of its size.

products.name: The Fitness Belt
products.description: A nifty and lightweight belt to fuel your workouts. Hold your smartphone, Raycon earbuds, and other daily essentials for your run or gym sessions.

18.title: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund
18.subtitle: Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice in a society that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans. LDF also defends the gains and protections won over the past 75 years of civil rights struggle and works to improve the quality and diversity of judicial and executive appointments.

19.title: The Sentencing Project
19.subtitle: The Sentencing Project promotes effective and humane responses to crime that minimize imprisonment and criminalization of youth and adults by promoting racial, ethnic, economic, and gender justice.

19.title: How the Negro National League Was Formed | Field of Dreams...Deferred
19.subtitle: The Negro National League debuted 100 years ago with world-class players and legions of fans. Hear how founder Rube Foster formed the league in Part 1 of "Field of Dreams...Deferred," a four-part series from TBS.

20.title: Intersectionality Matters! Podcast
20.subtitle: Intersectionality Matters! is a podcast hosted by Kimberlé Crenshaw, an American civil rights advocate and a leading scholar of critical race theory.

20.subtitle: Police said the shooter has been charged with murder in what officials are calling a hate crime and a case of racially motivated violent extremism.

22.subtitle: In his 39 years (1929-1968) Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. became one of the leading figures in the civil rights movement.

23.title: The Words of Martin Luther King Jr. Reverberate in a Tumultuous Time
23.subtitle: Dr. King’s speeches have particular resonance today amid a year of sickness and death, Black Lives Matter protests and the storming of the Capitol.

23.title: RayTec Audio
23.subtitle: RayTec, wherever you go, your soundtrack should follow. Music has changed the world. It's a form of expression and should be heard at the highest, premium level. When you hear music that you like, when you're listening to a book of your choosing, you get excited, or motivated or you may become active.

products.name: RayTec Wireless Speaker

24.title: 210 Teas
24.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

24.title: Fight for Breonna
24.subtitle: Breonna survived the frontlines of a pandemic that disproportionately kills Black people, only to have her life stolen by police. Take Action.

25.title: How easy (or hard) is it to confuse a gun for a Taser?
25.subtitle: Oscar Grant. Eric Harris. Daunte Wright. April 11, 2020 added another name to the list of Black men killed by police officers who intended to deploy a Taser but instead fired a handgun.

25.title: Justice for Dominique Fells
25.subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

26.title: Support our Young Protest Leaders #freetianna
26.subtitle: On Tuesday, July 21, Tianna Arata was arrested by San Luis Obispo PD at about 8 p.m. near Mitchell Park as she and other demonstrators were loading up a car after the protest had already dispersed.

26.title: Enough is Enough! Fire the Cops Who Killed Daunte Wright
26.subtitle: Here’s what we know: Police officers in Brooklyn Center, a Minneapolis suburb, shot and killed Daunte Wright during a traffic stop on Sunday, April 11. An unnamed police officer shot a gun into Daunte’s car, and his car then hit another vehicle. A passenger in Daunte’s care was injured, and Daunte was pronounced dead at the scene.

27.title: National Bail Out
27.subtitle: National Bail Out is a Black-led and Black-centered collective of abolitionist organizers, lawyers and activists building a community-based movement to support our folks and end systems of pretrial detention and ultimately mass incarceration. We are people who have been impacted by cages — either by being in them ourselves or witnessing our families and loved ones be encaged. We are queer, trans, young, elder, and immigrant.

27.title: The History of Mass Incarceration
27.subtitle: From Alexis de Tocqueville to Ronald Reagan, learn more about the forces that have shaped the current state of our prison system.

28.title: Seven factors that contribute to American racism
28.subtitle: Of the seven factors the researchers identified, perhaps the most insidious is passivism or passive racism, which includes an apathy toward systems of racial advantage or denial that those systems even exist.

28.title: Biased: Uncovering the Hidden Prejudice That Shapes What We See, Think, and Do
28.subtitle: With a perspective that is at once scientific, investigative, and informed by personal experience, Dr. Jennifer Eberhardt offers us the language and courage we need to face one of the biggest and most troubling issues of our time.

29.title: Justice for Tete Gulley
29.subtitle: Tete Gulley was a 31 year old queer Black transient. She was also known by some of her family as Otis. She was found hanging from a tree on the evening of May 27th 2019 in Rocky Butte Park. The cause of death was determined to be suicide at the scene but there is evidence of foul play.

29.title: Swimming caps designed for natural hair banned from Tokyo Olympic Games
29.subtitle: Swimming caps designed for natural Black hair — and created by a Black-owned company — will not be allowed at the upcoming Olympic Games in Tokyo. The International Swimming Federation said the caps do not follow "the natural form of the head," British brand Soul Cap told BBC News.

30.title: Support the King Center
30.subtitle: The King Center remain committed to proactively educating and training individuals and leaders across all sectors in Nonviolence365 to influence equitable change in our national and global infrastructure.

30.title: Princess Omalie
30.subtitle: Welcome To The Wonderful World Of Princess Omalie Unlock the magic and lore of The kingdom of IgboOrai, Africa’s oldest Monarchy and greatest dynasty of kings and queens! We’ve been waiting for you!

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Gala Edition
products.description: Princess Omalie comes from a royal lineage of beautiful elegant women and embodies the kindness, confidence and excitement of young girls today. In this Gala Edition, she is exquisitely dressed and coiffed.

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Coronation Edition
products.description: Princess Omalie comes from a royal lineage of beautiful elegant women and embodies the kindness, confidence and excitement of young girls today. In this Coronation Edition, she is exquisitely dressed and coifed in a rich, soft cape and a smooth silky costume, designed by "Atelier de Babazongo" – dressmakers of the Royal family. As a treat, she holds a special key as your invitation to unlock the magic of her kingdom.

products.name: Princess Omalie, The Coronation And The Polka Dot Lamb
products.description: Princess Omalie of the African kingdom of IgboOrai could be the happiest girl on the planet — except that her family has been under a curse. Unless the curse of the Goliath beetle necklace is lifted, Omalie’s father might die in a horrible freak accident. He might never be crowned king. Omalie worries about her family, and about her own safety; how will she ever lead a peaceful happy life, have friends, and go to school?

31.title: 11 Black Athletes Who Made Winter Olympic History
31.subtitle: Black Olympic athletes come from a long line of pioneers who made it possible for them to compete and win at the Olympics. And even though the Olympic Games have been around for centuries, there are still Black athletes who become the first to compete in their sport at the Olympics.

31.title: All Hip-Hop
31.subtitle:
AllHipHop.com was founded and launched in 1998 by CEO’s "Grouchy" Greg Watkins and Chuck "Jigsaw" Creekmur.

After many years of developing the site, AllHipHop.com has become a valuable resource for hip-hop on the internet, featuring daily news, interviews, reviews, multimedia, a fast growing community and other interesting content.

Publications such as CNN, The Source, XXL, Complex, New York Post, The New York Times and many others cite AllHipHop.com’s news and features due to our accuracy and trustworthiness.
